name: C. And Matching
statement:
You are given a set of n (n is always a power of 2) elements containing
all integers 0, 1, 2,
ldots, n-1 exactly once.Find
frac{n}{2} pairs of elements such that: Each element in the set is in
exactly one pair. The sum over all pairs of the bitwise AND of its
elements must be exactly equal to k. Formally, if a_i and b_i are the
elements of the i-th pair, then the following must hold:
sum_{i=1}^{n/2}{a_i
& b_i} = k, where
& denotes the bitwise AND operation. If there are many solutions, print
any of them, if there is no solution, print -1 instead.
